name: openplantbook-mcp
description: Access OpenPlantbook's crowd-sourced plant care database from Claude
long_description: The OpenPlantbook MCP Server provides Claude with access to comprehensive plant care information including light, temperature, humidity, and moisture requirements for thousands of plant species. Search plants by name, get detailed care requirements, compare sensor readings against ideal conditions, and receive human-readable care summaries.

api_key.title: OpenPlantbook API Key
api_key.description: Your API key from https://open.plantbook.io/apikey/show/ - Use EITHER api_key OR (client_id + client_secret), not both

client_id.title: OAuth2 Client ID
client_id.description: OAuth2 client ID for full API access - Use EITHER (client_id + client_secret) OR api_key, not both

client_secret.title: OAuth2 Client Secret
client_secret.description: OAuth2 client secret for full API access - Use EITHER (client_id + client_secret) OR api_key, not both

log_level.title: Log Level
log_level.description: Logging verbosity: debug, info, warn, error (default: info)

log_file.title: Log File Path
log_file.description: Optional path to log file for debugging (logs to stderr if not specified)

tools.name: search_plants
tools.description: Search for plants by common or scientific name in the OpenPlantbook database. Returns plant IDs (pid) in lowercase with spaces (e.g., 'monstera deliciosa').

tools.name: get_plant_care
tools.description: Get detailed care requirements for a specific plant including moisture, temperature, light, and humidity ranges. Use the exact 'pid' value from search_plants (lowercase with spaces, e.g., 'monstera deliciosa').

tools.name: get_care_summary
tools.description: Get a human-readable summary of plant care requirements with interpreted ranges. Use the exact 'pid' value from search_plants (lowercase with spaces, e.g., 'ocimum basilicum').

tools.name: compare_conditions
tools.description: Compare actual sensor readings against ideal plant care ranges and identify issues. Use the exact 'pid' value from search_plants (lowercase with spaces).

tools.name: server_info
tools.description: Get server version, build information, and runtime status
